title: How to Make a Brazilian Danoninho

steps.headline: Pour it into a tray (or wherever you want to);
Put it in the fridge, not the freezer as shown, and leave it there for at least 30 minutes;
steps.description:
The more it stays there, the thicker it will get. text:
Blend it all up; Pour it into a tray (or wherever you want to); Put it in the fridge, not the freezer as shown, and leave it there for at least 30 minutes; The more it stays there, the thicker it will get. You can add extra ingredients to it so it gets tastier! {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/79\/Make-a-Brazilian-Danoninho-Step-3Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Brazilian-Danoninho-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/79\/Make-a-Brazilian-Danoninho-Step-3Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Brazilian-Danoninho-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Chocolate candies are one of the BEST options! They fit extremely well with Danoninho. Enjoy!
